There is truly nothing more refreshing than a cold glass of salted watermelon juice. Oh wait, but what about a salted watermelon margarita? Here’s a recipe for that too. This recipe is part of the Healthyish Farmers’ Market Challenge. Get all 10 recipes here.IngredientsMakes about 4 cups6cups cubed watermelon (from ¾ of a 6-lb. baby seedless watermelon)¾tsp. kosher saltLime wedges (for serving; optional)PreparationStep 1Purée watermelon in a blender until smooth. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a large pitcher or measuring glass, pressing on solids to extract as much juice as possible; discard solids. Mix in salt.Step 2Pour juice into ice-filled glasses. Garnish with lime wedges if desired.How would you rate Salted Watermelon Juice?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (2)Back to TopTriangle*Garnish with a shot of tequila and splash of simple syrup*SBGAthens, GA7/1/2021How did I make it this far through the summer without this!
